name: A Few "H.E.A.T"ed Questions Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where was the agent from that came to Puerto Vallarta to arrest Cat for burglary in "Codename: Archangel"?
questions.explanation:
Scotland Yard.

	While investigating the theft of some art with the other members of her team, Cat was followed by an agent from Scotland Yard who was going to arrest her for a burglary she did a year before. The terms of a deal she made was if she went to work with the H.E.A.T. team and stayed for one year, specifically, her record would be expunged. She had a week to go before her first anniversary when the agent found her. After Cat saved his life, the agent released her.

questions.text: Which two former H.E.A.T. members returned in the season two episode, "Codename: Blood Ties"?
questions.explanation:
Brett and Marcos.

	Brett and Marcos returned for one episode in season two to celebrate Brett's engagement. When Brett's fiancé was kidnapped, the whole team came together to find her. After Marcos left the H.E.A.T. team, he began his own limo service. The only thing Tommy and Cat learned of Brett's new occupation was that they would have to be killed if Brett told them.

questions.text: In "Codename: Dangerous Bait", which team member took on a dual role?
questions.explanation:
Cat.

	Alison Armitage played Celia del Fuego, the wife of a Spanish diplomat as well as her original character, Catherine Pascal. Alison had to don a platinum blond wig and a Spanish accent for the role of Celia del Fuego.

questions.text: In "Codename: Dangerous Bait", how many pounds did Cat say she gained by eating to stop her toothache?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Cat had a toothache that consumed most of the episode "Codename: Dangerous Bait". She found that the only way to stop the pain was by eating, but by the time she had the tooth filled she had gained four pounds.

questions.text: What recreational sport did Mike always mention that he was involved in?
questions.explanation:
Boxing.

	Mike mentioned several times on the show that he used to box and in "Codename: Assassin" he was seen boxing in a dream.

questions.text: In "Codename: Deep Six", Tommy told Cat he would like to take a cruise, but would probably run into terrorists while on the ship.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Tommy, Cat and Brett were working with a deep sea diver to recover a sunken treasure in "Codename: Deep Six". While on the boat, Cat and Tommy saw a cruise liner. Tommy mentioned that he would like to take a cruise, but with his luck would run into terrorist while on the cruise liner.

questions.text: What was the name of the woman that took over Krissy's job in season two of "Acapulco H.E.A.T."?
questions.explanation:
Johanna.

	Christa Sauls played the part of Johanna Barnes in the second season of "Acapulco H.E.A.T." She was an Iowan with several aunts and uncles that were mentioned throughout the second season. Johanna did the computer work for the team and had a crush on Tommy.

questions.text: Which two team members showed romantic interest in each other during the first season of "Acapulco H.E.A.T."(besides Mike and Ashley)?
questions.explanation:
Marcos and Krissy.

	The first member of the team that Marcos met was Cat. He helped her chase a suspect in his cab, but it was Krissy that Marcos took a liking to. By the end of the season, the team knew that Marcos and Krissy were in love.

questions.text: On what special occasion was Mike shot in "Codename: Assassin"?
options: The first anniversary of the H.E.A.T. team
questions.explanation:
His birthday.

	Ashley had planned a special birthday picnic for she and Mike in the mountains. She was coming to get him from his walk on the beach when he was shot in front of her. This was the final episode of the first season and was supposed to be the final episode of the series, but the show was resurrected in 1998.

questions.text: What branch of the military was Brett in before he joined H.E.A.T.?
questions.explanation:
Navy.

	Brett mentioned in several episodes that he had been in the Navy, but in "Codename: Deep Six" it was revealed that he was part of an underwater demolition team. Brett was the team's bomb expert.
